item.title: Raw string literals in .NET7
item.description: Daily Knowledge Drop The new raw string literals feature coming as part of .NET7 (now available through the .NET7 preview) is a new format for dealing with strings, which allows for literals to contain whitespace, new lines, embedded quotes and other special characters without escape sequences. This new feature is especially useful when working with embedded language strings JSON, XML, HTML etc. Pre raw string literals Prior to the raw string literal functionality (before C#11), if building up a JSON string, especially when using string interpolation, a large number of escape characters were required:
